class whitenoise.storage.CompressedManifestStaticFilesStorage(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: django.contrib.staticfiles.storage.ManifestStaticFilesStorage

Extends ManifestStaticFilesStorage instance to create compressed versions of its output files and, optionally, to delete the non-hashed files (i.e. those without the hash in their name)

post_process(*args, **kwargs)[source]
post_process_with_compression(files)[source]
hashed_name(*args, **kwargs)[source]

stop_tracking_new_files()[source]
property keep_only_hashed_files[source]
delete_files(files_to_delete)[source]
create_compressor(**kwargs)[source]
compress_files(names)[source]
make_helpful_exception(exception, name)[source]

If a CSS file contains references to images, fonts etc that can’t be found then Django’s post_process blows up with a not particularly helpful ValueError that leads people to think WhiteNoise is broken.

Here we attempt to intercept such errors and reformat them to be more helpful in revealing the source of the problem.
